page.title: 07THE ARTS
page.content: The Stroud Festival is the main centre of opportunities in the arts. Many events take place in Sibly Hall which is part of the Wycliffe College. There are lots of things that take place like Ballet, Opera, Concerts, Drama, Recitals, Exhibitions, Literature and the graphic arts. There is a Music and Poetry Competition in which people from all over the world Compete in. There are many traditional events in this area. One of the most notable is Randwicks Annual Fair the Wap which uses several ancient customs like Mayor Making, the Wap Queen and cheese rolling .Other traditions include the Victory Park Show Day which takes place on 6th July at Cainscross. The village halls in the area are used for amateur productions, concert and film society meetings.
